Article.Abstract: OBJECTIVE: To identify T-cell epitopes of Ag85B by analysis of its sequence for prediction to bind HLA-DR alleles and evaluate the predicted peptides for recognition by T cells in antigen-induced proliferation assays. MATERIALS/SUBJECTS AND METHODS: The complete sequence of Ag85B was analyzed for HLA-DR binding prediction to 51 HLA-DR alleles by using a virtual matrix-based prediction program (ProPred). Synthetic peptides covering the sequence of mature Ag85B were also analyzed for binding to HLA-DR alleles, and evaluated for recognition in antigen-induced proliferation assays with Ag85B-specific T-cell lines established from the peripheral blood mononuclear cells of 10 HLA-DR-heterogeneous tuberculosis patients. RESULTS: The ProPred analysis of the full-length Ag85B (325 aa), signal peptide (40 aa) and the mature protein (285 aa) predicted their binding to 100, 76 and 98% of the 51 HLA-DR alleles, respectively. The analysis of 31 synthetic peptides for binding to HLA-DR alleles showed that 4 of them could bind >50% HLA-DR alleles, and were considered promiscuous. Testing of Ag85B-specific T-cell lines with synthetic peptides showed that all of the T-cell lines responded to one or more peptides of Ag85B, and 9 of the 10 cell lines responded to one or more of the four peptides considered promiscuous for binding to HLA-DR alleles. CONCLUSION: The ProPred program was useful in predicting the HLA-DR alleles binding regions of Ag85B and identifying the promiscuous peptides recognized by T cells.
Article.ArticleTitle: HLA-DR binding prediction and experimental evaluation of T-cell epitopes of mycolyl transferase 85B (Ag85B), a major secreted antigen of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antigens, Bacterial;Bacterial Proteins;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;HLA-DR Antigens;Acyltransferases;antigen 85B, Mycobacterium tuberculosis
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Acyltransferases(metabolism); Alleles; Antigens, Bacterial(metabolism); Bacterial Proteins(metabolism); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte; HLA-DR Antigens; Humans; Mycobacterium tuberculosis(enzymology); T-Lymphocytes(immunology)

Journal.Title: Medical principles and practice : international journal of the Kuwait University, Health Science Centre

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Full length of the protein (Ag85B) was analyzed using ProPred server for HLA DR binding peptides.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Heparinized venous blood was collected from 10 pulmonary tuberculosis patients. PBMC's were stimulated with the antigen (Ag85B). After 6 days IL-2 was added twice a week. The growing T cell lines were expanded in 24-well plates.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: T cell lines responded to the antigen (Ag85B) as well as to the peptide. The results shows that the T cell epitopes were scattered throughout the sequence of Ag85B.
